title: Taric's Daily Reminder
body:
Some champions have dashes, walls, untargetables, multiple skillshots, 6 different skills which are all great and new and revolutionary.

{{champion:44}} But are we really going to leave this relic here? I mean Skarner who got updates before is getting a revamp. Why does Taric still suffer this unbelievably dull playstyle?

replies.body: Taric needs a whole lot of work on the visual side as well as gameplay. Skarner could get a lot of gains on mostly the gameplay side. As a result, Skarner was able to be completed first. This isn't really a matter of Skarner instead of Taric. They're drawing from two different resource pools. You certainly won't be playing Taric in the next months, but he's actually coming along really well and I'm super excited for him.
Any chance of him coming out this year?
It will be cutting it close, but he should be ready early next year if not.

please don't make chances to him like you did to support raka...i want to keep one of my original 2 favorite supports alive...i mean a vu with a new dance would be really nice...make him less clunky...keep his point and stun, armor boost for allies, and a decent heal on him because he needs it and you don't need another braum...i'd be fine with seeing some updates/balances and even an entire ulti rework...but don't strip his core character away...a tanky protector who doesn't need to sit on you...though adding some skill ontop him would be nice then just a point and click...like you did with zil bombs...though zil's ulti as skillful anymore...freaking lower cd for the price of common sence

>.keep his point and stun, armor boost for allies, and a decent heal on him because he needs it

Look at previous "reworks" what's been being removed when it comes to cc.......
 {{champion:45}} lost his instant stun, {{champion:14}} lost his point and click (and with it ap scalings..), {{champion:16}} I believe used to have a point and click silence, {{champion:38}} removed silence (don't know if it was point and click but if it was like his current ult is I think I'm going to keep it here, and possibly others but I'm too lazy to look them up. But they're going to remove the point and click....)

But I'm sure you guys can tell more. Tl;dr, his stun is getting removed/given no more targeting

veigar still has his, and you still need a reaon to pick taric over braum in some intances...the point and stun will help with that, and i miss raka's e...i either give you mana or harass XD q.q

taric and braum are both tank proctecor supports that, instead of engaging themselves, open an engage for thier team. i actually like how well taric counters braum

Veigi doesn't have it instant any more. His still has the formation time. 

>....you still need a reaon to pick taric over braum in some intances...the point and stun will help with that....

Oh you misunderstood me. I want there to be silences and point and click cc. I like them in the game and think they're needed badly since there are such mobile champs. (Yeah I know it counters non-mobiles harder, but still something is needed for the mobility creep)

We will probably see it again,maybe even as mana restoring ability on an upcoming champion.
Does anyone beside me think that point and click CC abilities are justified on supports? It seems like they are the ones which make lets say ˝toxic˝abilities work.I mean Soraka has an AoE silence that can be placed instantly(a little buggy) but still insta AoE silence followed up with a snare.If it were on any other class it would be pretty toxic.

It Taric's case I think an AoE CC abillity would be better than an point&click...

Honestly, that doesn't really matter. I mean, yes, if it were an instant snare like {{champion:51}} trap combined with the silence after then it would be too flippin' brutal. However there is an element of counterplay or teamwork involved in it since the {{champion:16}} can predict where they're going to be, OR attempt to herd the enemy into a 1v whatever to avoid the snare. 

Now, moving on from just in supports in general, yeah. They usually aren't doing the damage, they're usually squishy, they're designed to protect an adc, so I don't see why they wouldn't be justified point and click cc. In fact, they can be justified on any champ tbh.
